author: vorot93
content: at this point I'm highly against standardizing JSONRPC - I believe we should focus on making a new gRPC-based API instead

author: vorot93
content: I'm working on one as we speak

author: pipermerriam
content: <@!329594653097721856> I think you'll have a very difficult time deposing JSON-RPC.  It's a very widely adopted standard at this stage being used by pretty much any piece of software that interacts with the chain, with tons of well established client libraries that have broad adoption.

author: pipermerriam
content: Do you have an "elevator pitch" for why gRPC-based API would be better?

author: pipermerriam
content: It seems like a marginal improvement to an API that seems to do it's job adequately but that's not based on any firm definition of what you're proposing.

author: jgm
content: May be worth pointing out that the same conversation was had for the ETH2 API a few months back, and even with no pre-existing tools or similar GRPC lost out to a REST-based API (to be fair, JSON-RPC was not accepted either).  Some reasons included the simplicity of having an API that connected easily for every programming language, availability to use from directly in a web browser,  requests and results easy to pass around in text-based messages, and familiarity of both implementers and users with the general methods to build and use such an API.

author: raulj
content: Adding on to that as a proponent of gRPC for ETH2, we are still able to use gRPC to its full capability in our client while being able to transcode it into JSON normally to align with the REST API standard

author: raulj
content: So to interact with our software, you can use the REST API standard for eth2 or use gRPC with all the protobuf jazz

author: raulj
content: but REST was the decided standard
